strings:
<voice_0x01000C6E><se_high>Emma: He's hardly eating a thing either.
And I could hear him weeping all through
the night yesterday.
<voice_0x01000C6F><se_high>Emma: He was such a benevolent and wise king when the Queen was still alive.
<voice_0x01000C70><se_high>Emma: I'm terribly sorry I'm of so little use to him.

<voice_0x01000C71><se_low>*: I see... So it continues.
It must be difficult for you, Emma.

<voice_0x01000C72><se_low>*: But I need you to keep trying.
If the King cannot recover from this,
the country will fall apart.
<voice_0x01000C73><se_low>*: ...I just don't know what to suggest.
<voice_0x01000C74><se_high>Emma: Ah, hello there! Do you seek an audience with the King of Ascantha?
<voice_0x01000C75><se_high>Emma: I'm afraid that His Majesty has been unavailable to visitors since the period of mourning for the late Queen began...two years ago.
<voice_0x01000C76><se_high>Emma: He comes down to the royal suite every night, but I doubt that he'll grant you an audience.
<voice_0x01000C77><se_high>Emma: ...I realise that that must seem strange to you, but if you return after dark, you'll see for yourselves.
